The Saint-Petersburg Huawei R&d department is looking to hire a Machine Learning Engineer into the NLU (Natural Language Understanding) team. Our team is in charge of the understanding of human’s intentions, based on the text received from automatic speech recognition (ASR) module, taking decisions based on what we understand from human’s query. Our module, along with the ASR and TTS (Text-to-speech) completely defines the human perception of the personality of the voice assistant.

The SRC in general and the Voice Assistant project in particular are relatively young. This means that if you join us now you will be at its roots, you can influence its course of action. The team is in general very flexible.

The company is headed towards innovation, the leaders and management listen to all the employees and are eager to integrate new ideas, both in terms of the solution we produce and the organization of our internal processes.

  • experience in Natural Language Processing;
  • practical experience in Big Data processing;
  • experience in cloud technologies and distributed systems.

CONDITIONS:

  • attractive compensation package + annual bonus;
  • medical insurance;
  • corporate discounts for purchasing devices;
  • flexible work hours, no dress code;
  • an opportunity to build the product that will be used by millions of people around the world;
  • “A” class business center located in the historical part of St. Petersburg (Zvenigorodskaya)

  • Накопление экспертизы по сопровождению конкретного вида БД и превращение ее в сервис, то есть автоматизация + внедрение на всех кластерах этого вида БД.
  • Поддержка рабочих контактов с командами разработки по сопровождению кластеров БД для обмена обратной связью, разбора проблемных ситуаций.
  • Работа в команде: обмен опытом, совместное владение и управление знаниями, формирование целей развития группы БД.

description:
About the project:

The system receives traffic from SSP systems (traffic aggregators from advertising sites that display the mobile ads) using the OpenRTB protocol. The system allows you to process up to 500 thousand requests per second.

SSP systems auction each request for a banner ad in real-time among all the signed aggregators of advertising companies (DSP). The auction is won by the DSP which offered the highest price. Our system works with mobile traffic and receives remuneration from advertisers for finding users that install their applications, and pays the SSPs for displaying the advertising banners, hence the business task of optimizing costs. Due to the high load and massive volumes, optimization and user-level targeting are only available through the use of machine learning.
